item.title: Sondland backed effort to 'shake up' leadership at Ukraine's state energy company
item.dc:creator: Dan De Luce and Josh Lederman and Ari Sen
item.description: The Ukrainian government saw Sondland's push as part of a broader effort linked to Giuliani and his associates.

media:content.media:description: Gordon Sondland, U.S. ambassador to the European Union, arrives at the Capitol on Oct. 17, 2019.

item.title: Hillary Clinton suggests Russia is grooming Gabbard for third-party run
item.dc:creator: Associated Press and Dareh Gregorian and Monica Alba
item.description: The Hawaii lawmaker responded by slamming the former first lady as "the queen of warmongers."

media:content.media:description: Tulsi Gabbard speaks during the Presidential Gun Sense Forum in Des Moines, Iowa, on Aug. 10, 2019.

item.title: HUD officials admit they knowingly stalled Puerto Rico housing relief funds
item.dc:creator: Nicole Acevedo
item.description: Lawmakers questioned why HUD kicked off a funding process for 17 states affected by disasters — but left out Puerto Rico.

media:content.media:description: A man walks by a house with the blue tarp that was used to protect the roof damaged by Hurricane Maria in San Juan, Puerto Rico, on Sept. 18, 2019.
A home destroyed by Hurricane Maria in Aibonito, Puerto Rico on Sept. 19, 2018.

item.title: Trump taps Energy Department's No. 2 to take over for Perry
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Allen and Shannon Pettypiece
item.description: Dan Brouillette, a quintessential Washington insider, is a "total professional," the president said.

media:content.media:text: Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Andrew Wheeler Makes Policy Announcement
media:content.media:description: Dan Brouillette, U.S. deputy secretary of energy, speaks at the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) headquarters in Washington on June 19, 2019.

item.title: Black school officer was fired for repeating racial slur used by black student
item.dc:creator: Janelle Griffith
item.description: The firing of Marlon Anderson in Madison, Wisconsin, prompted students to walk out in protest and school officials to say they will review their policies.

media:content.media:description: Marlon Anderson was fired from West High School in Madison, Wis., for telling an unruly student who called him the N-word several times not to call him the racial slur.

item.title: Cruise passenger banned for life after standing on balcony railing for photo
item.dc:creator: Elisha Fieldstadt
item.description: A narrow balcony railing was all that separated her from plunging into the water.

media:content.media:text: Image: Royal Caribbean's New Ship Allure Of The Seas
media:content.media:description: Royal Caribbean Cruises' Allure of the Seas ship in Turku, Finland, in 2010.

item.title: 'Maleficent' sequel features a magnificent Angelina Jolie — but a mediocre plot
item.dc:creator: Ani Bundel
item.description: “Maleficent: Mistress of Evil” isn't very good, but Jolie fans shouldn't worry — there's probably a third movie in the works.

media:content.media:description: What's in a name? Angelina Jolie stars in Disney's "Maleficent: Mistress of Evil."

item.title: Johnson & Johnson to recall 33,000 bottles of baby powder after asbestos found
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: The company also said it has started an investigation and is working with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

media:content.media:description: Bottles of Johnson & Johnson baby powder line a drugstore shelf in New York.

item.title: D.A. seeks murder charge against former Fort Worth officer who fatally shot Atatiana Jefferson
item.dc:creator: Janelle Griffith
item.description: "We will prosecute this case to the fullest extent of the law," the Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office said.

media:content.media:description: Atatiana Jefferson
Atatiana Jefferson

media:content.media:text: Image; Former Fort Worth officer Aaron Dean
media:content.media:description: Former Fort Worth officer Aaron Dean.

item.title: At least 62 dead in blast at Afghanistan mosque
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Mengli and Associated Press
item.description: The explosion took place as dozens of people gathered inside the mosque for weekly Friday prayers.

media:content.media:text: Image: A volunteer carries an injured youth to hospital, following a bomb blast in Haska Mina district of Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan
media:content.media:description: A volunteer carries an injured youth to a hospital following a blast during weekly Friday prayers in a mosque in Afghanistan.

item.title: After Boris Johnson's deal, is Brexit finally over? Not so fast
item.dc:creator: Alexander Smith
item.description: "Getting the deal through Parliament is going to be difficult but not necessarily impossible," one expert said.

media:content.media:text: Image: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, center, is greeted by Luxembourg's Prime Minister Xavier Bettel, center left, during a round table meeting at an EU summit in Brussels
media:content.media:description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, center, is greeted by Luxembourg's Prime Minister Xavier Bettel, center left, during a round table meeting at an EU summit in Brussels, Thursday, Oct. 17, 2019.
A European Union flag flies near Parliament in London.

item.title: Why did Turkey get America's nukes — and how come they're still there?
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Roblin
item.description: It’s folly for the U.S. to expose itself to potential nuclear blackmail by keeping these weapons in a country with which it's increasingly in conflict.

media:content.media:text: Image: An F-16 Fighting Falcon takes off from Incirlik Air Base, Turkey
media:content.media:description: An F-16 Fighting Falcon takes off from Incirlik Air Base, Turkey on Aug. 12, 2015. The base holds about 50 U.S. nuclear bombs, but the F-16s aren't able to deploy them.

item.title: Boeing knew for 'some months' about the dangers of the 737 Max, officials said
item.dc:creator: Jay Blackman and David K. Li
item.description: Company employees mentioned instabilities in the craft during a 2016 instant message chat.

media:content.media:text: Image: Rescuers work the scene of the Ethiopian Airlines crash near Addis Ababa on March 11, 2019.
media:content.media:description: Rescuers work the scene of the Ethiopian Airlines crash near Addis Ababa on March 11, 2019.

item.title: Nanny gets 20 years for sexually abusing child, having his baby
item.dc:creator: David K. Li
item.description: The victim, now 17, lives with his 5-year-old son. The teen and his mom are raising the boy.

media:content.media:description: Marissa Mowry.

media:content.media:credit: Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office via AP
media:content.media:description: Marissa Mowry.

item.title: China halts release of Quentin Tarantino's 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood'
item.dc:creator: Variety
item.description: One source told Variety the daughter of Bruce Lee has filed a complaint with China's National Film Administration about the on-screen depiction of her late father.

media:content.media:text: Image: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
media:content.media:description: Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt star in "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood."

item.title: How to put an end to paperclipping — quite possibly the most annoying dating trend yet
item.dc:creator: Danielle Page
item.description: The pattern of behavior consists of dropping off the face of the planet after a few dates only to follow up months later to see if you'll still respond to their aimless questions.

media:content.media:text: Illustration of a paper clip posing in a sexy way.
media:content.media:description: Paperclipping is a behavior based on "Clippy," the Microsoft help tool known for popping up whenever you didn't need him.

media:content.media:text: Illustration of a paper clip posing in a sexy way.

item.title: Illinois teen's 1991 disappearance from Devil's Playground remains a mystery
item.dc:creator: Andrea Cavallier
item.description: Joshua Mahaffey got into an argument with his mother and climbed out of his Centralia bedroom window on October 12, 1991. Witness Tonya Collins claims she saw him being tortured and murdered at nearby Devil’s Playground. His body has never been found. The Marion and Clinton County Sheriffs’ Offices are investigating.

item.title: Jane Fonda, Sam Waterston arrested at U.S. Capitol climate protest
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Fonda is returning to civil disobedience after a nearly half-century break, inspired by the climate activism of Swedish teenager Greta Thunberg.

media:content.media:description: Actress Jane Fonda gestures after being arrested during a rally on Capitol Hill on Oct. 18, 2019. A half-century after throwing her attention-getting celebrity status into Vietnam War protests, Fonda is now doing the same in a U.S. climate movement where the average age is 18.

media:content.media:text: Image: Jane Fonda leads Fire Drill Fridays outside the U.S. Capitol in Washington
media:content.media:description: Actor Sam Waterston is handcuffed and detained by Capitol Police during the "Fire Drill Fridays" protest outside the Library of Congress on Oct. 18, 2019.

item.title: 'Maude' co-star, character actor Bill Macy dies at 97
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: The stint as Walter Findlay on the CBS sitcom that aired from 1972-78 was Macy's highest-profile in a long stage, film and TV career.

media:content.media:description: Actor Bill Macy in Los Angeles on April 27, 1987.

item.title: Wine, cheese … and planes: Experts say Trump opens a dangerous new front in E.U. tariff fight
item.dc:creator: Martha C. White
item.description: Long lead times and a lack of excess production capacity mean that it isn’t feasible for airlines to simply switch suppliers.

media:content.media:description: A woman cuts a piece of Parmigiano Reggiano Parmesan cheese on Oct. 18, 2019 in a cheese shop in Saluzzo, near Turin, Italy.
Wine bottles on display in Le Cannet-des-Maures, in the Provence region of France.

item.title: Two decades later, 'Dawson's Creek' actor reflects on historic gay kiss
item.dc:creator: Gwen Aviles
item.description: In the show’s 1998 season 3 finale, two actors shared what is considered TV’s first “passionate” kiss between two men.

media:content.media:text: DAWSON'S CREEK, Kerr Smith, Katie Holmes, James Van Der Beek, Joshua Jackson, Michelle Williams, (Se
media:content.media:description: From left, Kerr Smith, Katie Holmes, James Van Der Beek, Joshua Jackson and Michelle Williams in a promotional photo for the fifth season of "Dawson's Creek."
Kerr Smith as Jack McPhee in "Dawson's Creek."

item.title: These new fall cookbooks will inspire you to make dinner tonight
item.dc:creator: Nicole Spector
item.description: These hotly anticipated new cookbooks will inspire you to be a better cook — whether you have a few minutes on a weeknight or a few hours on Sunday afternoon.

media:content.media:description: "Nothing Fancy: Unfussy Food for Having People Over" by Alison Roman, "Antoni in the Kitchen" by Antoni Porowski and Mindy Fox, "Cannelle et Vanille: Nourishing, Gluten-Free Recipes for Every Meal and Mood" by Aran Goyoaga.

item.title: Hong Kong court upholds ban on same-sex marriage
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Homosexuality has been decriminalized since 1991 in Hong Kong, a former British colony that returned to Chinese rule in '97, but gay unions remain illegal.

media:content.media:description: Participants hold a large rainbow flag as they take part in the annual pride parade at Victoria park in Hong Kong on Nov. 17, 2018.

item.title: Buttigieg campaign cuts ties with donor linked to Laquan McDonald case
item.dc:creator: Josh Lederman and Priscilla Thompson and Associated Press
item.description: "Transparency and justice for Laquan McDonald is more important than a campaign contribution," spokesman Chris Meagher said in a statement.

media:content.media:text: Image: Democratic Presidential Candidate Pete Buttigieg Campaigns In Des Moines, Iowa
media:content.media:description: South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg speaks at a town hall meeting he hosted at Roosevelt High School on Oct. 12, 2019, in Des Moines, Iowa.

media:content.media:text: Chicago mayor apologizes for Laquan McDonald shooting
media:content.media:description: Mayor Emanuel and Steve Patton, corporation counsel, listen as Alderman and former police sergeant Christopher Taliaferro, 29th, speaks in favor of a resolution to create a task force looking into police misconduct but wants to see it expanded with more people who are not insiders on Dec. 9, 2015 at the Chicago City Council in Chicago.

item.title: Actress Sônia Braga merges the personal, political and cinematic
item.dc:creator: Monica Castillo
item.description: “I don't think I would be able to work with a great face, a great actor but doesn't care or understand...the things we believe in,” said filmmaker Kleber Mendonça Filho about Braga.

media:content.media:description: Sonia Braga attends the screening of "Elle" at the annual 69th Cannes Film Festival at Palais des Festivals on May 21, 2016 in Cannes, France.
Brazilian actress Sonia Braga shows her red painted hands to symbolize blood, during a protest in defense of the Amazon while fires burn in that region, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Aug, 25, 2019.
